title: Reroutes cannot be used as compact visual switch in 1.15
body:
Hello, 

I know it's not a widespread usage, but I really liked to use the old `Reroute` nodes as a visual UI switch : 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f3697471-dadd-45fa-bf9d-e2f1b3289790)

This allows me to refer to a distant portion of the workflow and visually choose the route to use. This representation feels more natural to me than a regular integer switch.

Sadly, with the new implementation of the reroute nodes in 1.15 and later, the "orphan" reroute nodes are discarded, and cannot be used in this manner anymore :  

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f0d3b1f1-f648-4d53-88a5-181deceabcb0)

Even if I force the creation of an orphan `Reroute` node, it is greyed and cannot be connected to another reroute easily : 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/890063c7-405e-442a-825d-2bafb400a511)

I would like a way to use the orphan nodes as a visual switch like before, to maintain compatibility with my older workflows.

Barring this choice, I guess I'll use Get/Set nodes as a workaround, but it would be great if we could select the output of a collapsed node as long as there is only one. For example here : 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/56506732-63df-4ac5-8e8c-b7783b299930)

Even if the scheduler all have a single output, I must expand those to be able to connect it to the reroute node. I could use a `Switch (Any)` node instead, but it has a really bigger footprint.

Anyone knows a good compact switch node ? Even using a collapsed switch node with a single integer constant node expanded aside to make the selection takes way more space than the visual switch trick.

Anyway, thanks for hearing my rant. 😅

┆Issue is synchronized with this [Notion page](https://www.notion.so/Issue-3247-Reroutes-cannot-be-used-as-compact-visual-switch-in-1-15-1c36d73d365081ea9db1e85dfdbc2866) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

title: Improve performance when large number of prompts are queued
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

There are some users who queue a large number of prompts at a time with large graphs. It is commonly reported from them that overall performance suffers a lot when doing this. The issue is the frequency and eagerness of requests/messages to the queue endpoint.

### Reproduction Steps

1. Open DevTools in the browser (F12)
2. Go to the Network tab
3. In the search/filter bar type 'queue'
4. Go back to the graph without closing DevTools
5. Create a workflow with a lot of nodes
6. Increase the batch count on the `Run` button to a high number
7. Press `Run`
8. Observe the `/queue` responses in the Network panel:
    ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d27ee149-29ba-47f5-b943-451d5b74e411)
10. Notice that:
    - The `/queue` response includes the entire workflow for every single pending task (along with other fields). The type is here:
    https://github.com/Comfy-Org/ComfyUI_frontend/blob/8db088b27a5669e423b1d2644fa574bf4a3c3d85/src/schemas/apiSchema.ts#L185-L193
    - Requests to `/queue` are eager
    - The `queueStore` updates the queue and history in the same `update` action. As a result, `/queue` requests are made when tasks are created and when tasks are completed, which is probabaly not necessary. 
    - Requests to `/queue` are made for each task created, even those created in batches

### Possible solutions

1. Send prompts to server less eagerly when batch size of queue button is large
3. Only request necessary properties of queued prompts
4. Don't repeatedly request information about queued items since they are not subject to change
5. Add `max_items` param to queue endpoint, similar to history 
6. Evaluate graph less eagerly or use DP, although the issue seems to be with the large frequent requests rather than graph evaluation
 
### Proposed workflow

1. Load large graph
2. Increase batch count to 200+ e.g., to run over-night or while out of house
3. Press queue button
4. The app works at same efficiency/speed as it does during normal usage

### Additional information

The `/history` endpoint, used for completed tasks, faced the same issue in the past. It was solved by limiting the number of items returned in the request (https://github.com/Comfy-Org/ComfyUI_frontend/pull/393).

The `maxItems` arg is supported in the `/history` route handler on the backend, but not for the `/queue` handler.

For reference, implementation of `max_items` for `/history`:

- [Backend](https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/blob/94f21f93012173d8f1027bc5f59361cf200b8b37/server.py#L603-L608)
- [Frontend](https://github.com/Comfy-Org/ComfyUI_frontend/blob/f7b613c6cb34955176c586e7b27f8f7a00841b96/src/stores/queueStore.ts#L335-L363)

### Related issues

- https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/issues/2000#issuecomment-2631586686
- https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/discussions/7284
- https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/issues/6939
- https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/issues/6676
- https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/issues/5073
- https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/issues/2000
- https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI/issues/8070

┆Issue is synchronized with this [Notion page](https://www.notion.so/Issue-2435-Improve-performance-when-large-number-of-prompts-are-queued-1916d73d3650817182f1d64620824b60) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

title: [Feature Request]: Change window-close confirm dialog to only open if there are unsaved workflows
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

Currently there is a setting called `Comfy.Window.UnloadConfirmation`:

![Selection_756](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2f8712c9-841f-4319-90fc-d3d8646ea9a9)

The confirm dialog opens whenever the user leaves the page, regardless of whether there are any unsaved changes or not. This feature would change the dialog such that it only opens if there are unsaved changes. 

### Proposed workflow

1. Attempt to navigate away from the page or reload
3. Confirm dialog appears only if there are unsaved changes.

### Additional information

This was mentioned in the original PR (https://github.com/Comfy-Org/ComfyUI_frontend/pull/690) where the dialog was implemented:

> On window close, a browser level dialog will be poped up to remind user unsaved changes. The browser message cannot be customized due to security reasons enforced by browser vendors.
> 
> The default setting value is false. Later after the workflow manager redesign, we should have the dialog popup based whether there is unsaved content. Currently the dialog just always trigger on close based on the setting value.


┆Issue is synchronized with this [Notion page](https://www.notion.so/Issue-2254-Feature-Request-Change-window-close-confirm-dialog-to-only-open-if-there-are-unsave-17c6d73d3650813baf4bee4ac2de30eb) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

title: [Feature Request]: [ Aesthetics  ] Match the "small" Sidebar to the Topbar dimensions
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

The "normal" Sidebar, it's to wide for me. 
I like the "small" Sidebar, but it's a bit too narrow.

I have a 27 inch, FHD monitor ( 1920 x 1080 )

title: What should I do to make the images and links show up on top of the ui at the same time, and when each image is displayed, it also displays its link.
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

What should I do to make the images and links show up on top of the ui at the same time, and when each image is displayed, it also displays its link.
It's a py file with a txt suffix that I changed for easy uploading

### Proposed workflow

I want to be able to display both images and links, how should I change the code?
----------------------------------------------------------
import os
import json
import numpy as np
from PIL import Image, PngImagePlugin
from comfy.cli_args import args
import folder_paths

class SaveImage_nas_oss0:
    def __init__(self):
        self.output_dir = folder_paths.get_output_directory()
        self.type = "output"
        self.prefix_append = ""
        self.compress_level = 4

    @classmethod
    def INPUT_TYPES(s):
        return {"required":
                    {"images": ("IMAGE", ),  # 指定输入类型为图像
                     "filename_prefix": ("STRING", {"default": "ComfyUI"})},  # 文件名前缀
                "hidden": {"prompt": "PROMPT", "extra_pnginfo": "EXTRA_PNGINFO"},
                }

    RETURN_TYPES = ()
    FUNCTION = "save_image_nas_oss"

    OUTPUT_NODE = True

    CATEGORY = "save_image_nas_oss"
    def save_img_oss(self, local_img_path,img_name):
        import oss2
        access_key_id = str(os.getenv("ALIYUN_OSS_ACCESS_KEY_ID"))
        access_key_secret = str(os.getenv("ALIYUN_OSS_ACCESS_KEY_SECRET"))
        bucket_name = str(os.getenv("ALIYUN_OSS_BUCKET_NAME"))
        endpoint = str(os.getenv("ALIYUN_OSS_ENDPOINT"))
        auth = oss2.Auth(access_key_id, access_key_secret)
        bucket = oss2.Bucket(auth, endpoint, bucket_name)
        oss_img_name = f'test/comfyui/{img_name}'
        bucket.put_object_from_file(oss_img_name, local_img_path)
        oss_url = "https://{}.{}/{}".format(bucket_name, endpoint, oss_img_name)
        return oss_url

    def save_image_nas_oss(self, images, filename_prefix="ComfyUI", prompt=None, extra_pnginfo=None):
        # 为文件名前缀添加自定义前缀
        filename_prefix += self.prefix_append
        # 获取图像保存路径和文件名
        full_output_folder, filename, counter, subfolder, filename_prefix = folder_paths.get_save_image_path(filename_prefix, self.output_dir, images[0].shape[1], images[0].shape[0])
        oss_urls = []  # 用来存储每个图片的OSS URL
        results = []
        for batch_number, image in enumerate(images):
            # 将图像从Tensor转换为0到255范围的numpy数组
            i = 255. * image.cpu().numpy()
            img = Image.fromarray(np.clip(i, 0, 255).astype(np.uint8))
            metadata = None

            # 添加元数据
            if not args.disable_metadata:
                metadata = PngImagePlugin.PngInfo()
                if prompt is not None:
                    metadata.add_text("prompt", json.dumps(prompt))
                if extra_pnginfo is not None:
                    for x in extra_pnginfo:
                        metadata.add_text(x, json.dumps(extra_pnginfo[x]))

            # 生成带批次编号的文件名
            filename_with_batch_num = filename.replace("%batch_num%", str(batch_number))
            img_name = f"{filename_with_batch_num}_{counter:09}_.png"
            # 保存图像
            img.save(os.path.join(full_output_folder, img_name), pnginfo=metadata, compress_level=self.compress_level)
            oss_url = self.save_img_oss(local_img_path=os.path.join(full_output_folder, img_name),img_name=img_name)
            # 记录OSS URL
            results.append({
                "filename": img_name,
                "subfolder": subfolder,
                "type": self.type
            })

            oss_urls.append({
                "oss_url": oss_url,
                "subfolder": subfolder,
                "type": self.type
            })
            counter += 1

        # 返回结果：图像文件名和路径
        return {
            "ui": {"images": results,"oss_urls": oss_urls},
        }
NODE_CLASS_MAPPINGS = {
        "save_image_nas_oss": SaveImage_nas_oss0
}

# A dictionary that contains the friendly/humanly readable titles for the nodes
NODE_DISPLAY_NAME_MAPPINGS = {
    "save_image_nas_oss": "save_image_nas_oss"
}

title: [Feature Request]: Blender-like node interface
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

### Feature Idea

I’ve noticed that the current node interface in ComfyUI has its own unique approach, but I believe adopting Blender’s node design could significantly enhance user experience.

### Existing Solutions

Consider implementing Blender’s node design, where each node has both a text input box and a connection input. Here’s a visual example of what I’m referring to:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e892d95-6879-4d19-a9e9-080c537fac46)
In ComfyUI, users must manually convert their desired input, which can be time-consuming and less intuitive compared to Blender’s approach.
Here are some advantages of Blender's node interface:
- Dual Input Mode: Nodes should display both a text input box and a connection port. This allows for quick adjustments and direct connections.
- Automatic Textbox Disable: When a node’s input is connected to another node’s output, the text input box should be automatically disabled. This prevents conflicting inputs and streamlines the workflow.

### Proposed workflow

i don't know how it works, but you may can check blender's source code, it is open source.

### Additional information

_No response_

title: [Feature Request]: The top menu (beta new menu) should really display the batch count at all times
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

For anyone who switches batch counts it's very annoying to hit the queue button and unexpectedly queue up 18 things because you genuinely forgot what number it was set to before.

There's actually a good reason why this happens - after you queue a bunch of stuff with a high batch count set, you will minimize the window or alt-tab and then time passes while you do something else, at that point you forget what number it was previously set to.

So you can see how this kind of thing will happen to absolutely everybody: Time passes while performing a long queue -> you forget what number it was, because so much time passed.

### Proposed workflow

![Untitled](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a03570aa-75ef-4acf-919f-cb4761de8567)

There might be a more elegant solution than this. I don't really care how it's done, you could even just change the text color of "Queue" to yellow whenever it's set to more than 1, even that would solve the problem.

### Additional information

_No response_

title: [Feature Request]: Monitoring resource usage inside ComfyUI
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

Being able to monitor CPU, GPU, VRAM and RAM usage directly inside ComfyUI is really useful for many people.

Since the `Resources monitor` plug-in from [ComfyUI-Crystools](https://github.com/crystian/ComfyUI-Crystools) isn't compatible with the new front-end, I would suggest integrating this kind of feature natively into the new front-end.

![monitor](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/94777e94-2f6e-4041-897a-957f46e726a0)



### Proposed workflow

First, I would suggest using circular bars since they are nicer than regular bars and give a modern look, in line with the new front-end style.

![circular_progress_bars](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/05cd1312-8380-46f3-9557-f0265b481d98)

___

### Option 1: Circular bars in the center of the main menu
 
![resouces_monitor_main_menu](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e10219fa-5f95-4357-9267-5930ecafba3b)

Pros: Always visible 
Cons: They will be really tiny and there is not enough room for resouce labels (CPU, RAM, GPU, VRAM, ecc. )

___

### Option 2: Circular bars in a new "Performance" tab

![resouces_monitor_sidebar](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/41b84c63-d74d-47c0-a2e5-bb72533bd8be)

Pros: It could be similar to Crystools's `Resouces monitor`, but well integrated with the new front-end style
Cons: You need to keep the tab open

___

### Option 3: Circular bars in a new dedicated window on the opposite side of the sidebar (recommended)

![resouces_monitor_standalone](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f9406e3e-5ae2-4ff2-b3ed-eb007aa6760c)

Pros: All resouces are clearly displayed, always visible and the window can be easily toggled on/off using a button in the main menu
Cons: I can't think of any at the moment

___

In any case, in settings you can select which resorces you want to display, similar to Crystools's `Resouces monitor`:

![monitor-settings](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3fe8bd05-7a15-4da2-a052-3f260671bb2b)



### Additional information

_No response_
